name: leaves on head
notes:
**pattern notes**
the hat is worked from the brim to the top in the round, following the chart.
you will need some experience with stranded colorwork technique.

**yarn** 
dlana* la madrilana (100g / 450m)
or any fingering weight yarn similar. you will need two different colors. i have spent approximately 20 grams of each color.
colors used in the sample: tweed green (011) and natural/undyed (01)

**needles and notions** 
-3.5 mm circular needle (40cm / 16in) and 3.5 mm dpns for decrease section; or your preferred type for working hat circumference.
-1 stitch marker (optional: 9 extra markers to separate chart repeats)
-tapestry needle
-scissors 

**gauge**
20 sts and 27 rounds to 10cm / 4in over stockinette stitch
28 sts and 29 rounds to 10cm / 4in over colorwork 
gauge are after blocking and without stretching the garment, using 3,5mm needle.

**size**
to fit head 55-60cm / 21-23in circumference

**measurements** 
brim circumference: 49cm / 19in
head circumference: 51cm / 20in
length from brim to top: 25cm / 10in 
measurements are after blocking and without stretching the garment.
